Sentencas: The exergy concept has been used to analyze two methane-fueled SOFC systems.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: The systems include preheating of fuel and air, reforming of methane to hydrogen, and combustion of the remaining fuel in an afterburner.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: An iterative computer program using a sequential-modular approach was developed and used for the analyses.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Simulation of an SOFC system with external reforming yielded first-law and second-law efficiencies of 58 and 56%, respectively, with 600% theoretical air.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Heat released from the afterburner was used to reform methane, vaporize water, and preheat air and fuel.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: When these heat requirements were satisfied, the exhaust-gas temperature was so low that it could only be used for heating rooms or water.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Because of heat requirements in the system, fuel utilization (FU) in the FC was limited to 75%.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: The remaining fuel was used for preheating and reforming.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Reduced excess air led to reduced heat requirements and the possibility of a higher FU in the FC.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Irreversibilities were also reduced and efficiencies increased.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems

Sentencas: Recycling fuel and water vapor from the FC resulted in first-law and second-law efficiencies of 75.5 and 73%, respectively, with 600% theoretical air, vaporization of water was avoided and the FU was greater.
Titulo: Energy analysis of solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems
